New Records: Paul Stirling made 88 from 92 deliveries, setting a new best for Ireland’s highest opening partnership against South Africa in ODI cricket with Andrew Balbirnie (101 for the first wicket).
Key Match Events: Paul Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie made 101 for the first wicket, setting a new best for Ireland’s highest opening partnership against South Africa in ODI cricket.
Harry Tector scored 60 from 48 balls, providing a welcome return to form for the 24-year-old.
Mark Adair and Graham Hume quickly settled into their work with the new ball, picking up a wicket apiece to dismiss both openers and leave South Africa stunned at 8-2.
Kyle Verreynne scored 38 but couldn’t build on his start, and by the time he fell to Craig Young, the Proteas were struggling at 59-4.
Jason Smith and Andile Phehlukwayo frustrated Ireland until the latter top-edged a pull shot to Young, earning Fionn Hand a first wicket on his ODI debut.
Bjorn Fortuin (11) was bowled by Matthew Humphreys and Williams became Young’s third wicket.
Smith reached a well-made half century but could only watch on as Bjorn Fortuin (11) was bowled by Matthew Humphreys and Williams became Young’s third wicket.
Ireland sensed victory but Smith moved up a gear and was closing in on a century until he gave a chance to deep third off the bowling of Hume, leaving Ireland just one wicket away from a famous win.
Graham Hume picked up that wicket in the 47th over, delivering the perfect end to Ireland Men’s international year.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling made 88 from 92 deliveries, setting a new best for Ireland’s highest opening partnership against South Africa in ODI cricket with Andrew Balbirnie (101 for the first wicket).
